cell.html: Resigned on 20 April, 2006 after the role of Minister of Education, promised to him by Ariel Sharon , was given to Labour.
cell.text: Resigned on 20 April, 2006 after the role of Minister of Education, promised to him by Ariel Sharon , was given to Labour.

cell.html: Sharansky retired from politics and left the Knesset on 20 November, 2006.
cell.text: Sharansky retired from politics and left the Knesset on 20 November, 2006.
Stern died of cancer on 16 January, 2007.

cell.html: Naveh resigned to go into business on 27 February, 2007.
cell.text: Naveh resigned to go into business on 27 February, 2007.

cell.html: Bishara resigned from the Knesset on 22 April, 2007 due to a police investigation into his activities during the 2006 Lebanon War .
cell.text: Bishara resigned from the Knesset on 22 April, 2007 due to a police investigation into his activities during the 2006 Lebanon War .

cell.html: Peres resigned from the Knesset following his election as president on 13 June 2007.
cell.text: Peres resigned from the Knesset following his election as president on 13 June 2007.

cell.html: Breznitz retired from politics and left the Knesset on 8 October 2007.
cell.text: Breznitz retired from politics and left the Knesset on 8 October 2007.

cell.html: Yitzhaki resigned from the Knesset on 7 February 2008 due to "serious doubts over Ehud Olmert 's ability to lead the government in the wake of the Winograd Report ". [1]
cell.text: Yitzhaki resigned from the Knesset on 7 February 2008 due to "serious doubts over Ehud Olmert 's ability to lead the government in the wake of the Winograd Report ". [1]

cell.html: Benizri resigned from the Knesset on 27 April 2008 after being convicted of bribery.
cell.text: Benizri resigned from the Knesset on 27 April 2008 after being convicted of bribery.

cell.html: Sneh resigned from the Knesset on 28 May 2008 as he left Labour to found his own party
cell.text: Sneh resigned from the Knesset on 28 May 2008 as he left Labour to found his own party

context.text: List of Knesset members - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
[ edit ] Former members of the 17th Knesset

Labour have filed a law suit, alleging electoral fraud in several Arab settlements and requesting to grant it an additional seat at the expense of the United Arab List. If this suit proves successful, Zakour will be replaced with Labour's Shakib Shanan.

This title, called in Hebrew ( Memale Mekom Rosh HaMemshala , lit. Prime Minister's Place Filler), means Livni is first in line to replace the Prime Minister in case of incapacitation or death; it does not mean she currently exercises any Prime Ministerial duties.
Blue indicates a party is a member of the governing coalition, whilst red indicates that the party is in opposition.
List of Likud Knesset Members Arab members of the Knesset
The following is a list of the Members of the 17th Knesset, elected on 28 March 2006 and inaugurated 4 May 2006 , and their replacements.
^ Knesset to swear in 2nd Ethiopian MK Jerusalem Post, 8 February 2008

NamePartyReplaced byRemarks
Uriel ReichmanKadimaShai HermeshResigned on 20 April, 2006 after the role of Minister of Education, promised to him by Ariel Sharon, was given to Labour.
Natan SharanskyLikudHaim KatzSharansky retired from politics and left the Knesset on 20 November, 2006.
Yuri SternYisrael BeiteinuDavid RotemStern died of cancer on 16 January, 2007.
Dan NavehLikudYuli-Yoel EdelsteinNaveh resigned to go into business on 27 February, 2007.
Azmi BisharaBaladSaid NafaBishara resigned from the Knesset on 22 April, 2007 due to a police investigation into his activities during the 2006 Lebanon War.
Shimon PeresKadimaYitzhak Ben YisraelPeres resigned from the Knesset following his election as president on 13 June 2007.
Shlomo BreznitzKadimaYohanan PlesnerBreznitz retired from politics and left the Knesset on 8 October 2007.
Avigdor YitzhakiKadimaShlomo MulaYitzhaki resigned from the Knesset on 7 February 2008 due to "serious doubts over Ehud Olmert's ability to lead the government in the wake of the Winograd Report".[1]
Shlomo BenizriShasMazor BahainaBenizri resigned from the Knesset on 27 April 2008 after being convicted of bribery.
Efraim SnehLabourShakhiv Shana'anSneh resigned from the Knesset on 28 May 2008 as he left Labour to found his own party
